intro: Alchemilla baltica var. occidentalis, commonly known as western lady’s mantle, is a low-growing perennial plant native to northern Europe. It features basal leaves that are shield-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early summer, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This species is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in woodland settings.
